WRITING.TEXT: I think you need to focus on what your goal is then. Being a great player and being a great songwriter don't always go together. For example, I hate my lyrics most of the time, so I found a singer to write lyrics while I write the music. Likewise, keep a journal or a moleskine and write down phrases or things that stick out to you, the more you do it the more will pop out to you. Also I think guitar tone helps the writing process a lot. A loop pedal can be invaluable for practicing phrasing and delays or distortions can all inform your style. DAWs are great but should be the afterthought IMO, guitar is a tactile instrument and the best ideas come with your feet on the ground and your hand on the fretboard. Good Luck!
